description: The `agents` subsystem is a core analytical component, where various specialized agents perform static analysis and generate insights. These insights are meticulously structured using the `Agent Response Data Models`, which define a standardized schema for representing complex information such as source code references, inter-component relationships, and comprehensive analysis summaries. This structured output ensures consistency and facilitates seamless integration with downstream processes, enabling the generation of detailed documentation and visual architectural diagrams. The `Agent Response Data Models` act as a crucial interface, ensuring that the raw analytical output from the agents is transformed into a consumable format for higher-level output generation functionalities.

components.name: Agent Response Data Models
components.description: This component defines the standardized data structures and schemas used by various agents to encapsulate their analysis results, insights, and references. It includes models for source code references, inter-component relationships, and overall analysis summaries, facilitating consistent data representation for subsequent processing and output generation.

components.name: Agents
components.description: The `agents` subsystem is a core analytical component, where various specialized agents perform static analysis and generate insights.

components.name: External Output Processors
components.description: External components (e.g., documentation generators, diagram renderers) that consume and transform structured data into human-readable documentation and visual representations.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
